required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: The Effect of Emotion Regulation Training on Anxiety, in College Students in Egypt
clinical_study.official_title: The Effect of Emotion Regulation Training on Anxiety, in College Students in Egypt During COVID-19 Lockdown

brief_summary.textblock: The important role of Emotion Regulation (ER) in managing stress and anxiety is well recognized. Aims: 1) To assess the level of Anxiety, and the level of difficulties in emotion regulation (DER) among University Students, 2) to investigate the effect of emotional regulation training on anxiety of university Students during COVID-19. Methods: in Part I, we assessed 863 students for their anxiety, DER, impact of COVID-19. In part II, 200 students were recruited and randomly assigned to either a group that received emotion regulation training and or to a control group. The intervention group was trained about emotion regulation and problem solving during eight 90-min sessions. The students completed Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI) and DERS before and after the intervention.

detailed_description.textblock: 200 students agreed to participate in the experiment and were randomized to either experimental or control group. Assessments were collected from all students before intervention and after the intervention.

primary_outcome.description: Beck Anxiety Inventory (BAI): was developed by Dr. Aaron T. Beck and it is a brief measure of anxiety with a focus on somatic symptoms of anxiety such as nervousness, dizziness, inability to relax
Emotion regulation difficulties: The (DERS; Gratz & Roemer, 2004) is a 36-item self-report questionnaire that measures the extent to which individuals have difficulty regulating their emotions

arm_group.description: The training sessions were based on the Dialectical Behavior Therapy Skills (Linehan, 2015). The students in the experimental conditions were divided into 10 groups, there were 10 students in each group. Each group received eight 90-min sessions of the emotion regulation training (one session per week) carried out by qualified clinical psychologists in online settings using Microsoft Teams. The training includes online group gathering, homework and telephone consultation as needed.

intervention.intervention_name: Emotion Regulation training based on DBT
intervention.description: trained about emotion regulation and problem solving during eight 90-min group sessions

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Being an active student at the University
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Receiving treatment at the hospital during the time that the study was in progress
2. Having been diagnosed with psychotic disorders
3. Having mental retardation
